CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Up to now , the highest PCE of μmR - polymer was just 1.1% , based on poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine) by using complicated doubled active layers photovoltaic devices.

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Material Name" entities:

1. μmR - polymer
2. poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Sure, here are the entities in the paragraph that refer to "Material Name":

1. μmR - polymer
2. poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| μmR - polymer |
| poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine) |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Up to now , the highest PCE of μmR - polymer was just 1.1% , based on poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine) by using complicated doubled active layers photovoltaic devices.

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Property Name" entities:

1. PCE - "Photovoltaic Conversion Efficiency"
2. μmR - "Micromolar" (a unit of concentration)
3. poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine) - a specific type of polymer.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Sure, here are the relevant entities in the paragraph that refer to material properties:

1. PCE - "Photovoltaic Conversion Efficiency" (a material property)
2. μmR - "Micromolar" (a unit of concentration)

I removed the following entities that do not refer to material properties:

1. poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine) (a specific type of polymer)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to material properties, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCE (Photovoltaic Conversion Efficiency) |
| μmR (Micromolar) |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Up to now , the highest PCE of μmR - polymer was just 1.1% , based on poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine) by using complicated doubled active layers photovoltaic devices.

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Property Value" entities:

1. PCE: This stands for "Power Conversion Efficiency". It is a measure of the efficiency of a solar cell in converting sunlight into electrical energy.
2. μmR: This stands for "Micromolar". It is a unit of measurement used to express the concentration of a substance in a solution.
3. 1.1%: This is the value of the PCE of μmR-polymer, which is the highest value reported in the paragraph. It represents the percentage of sunlight that is converted into electrical energy by the solar cell.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here are the entities that refer to the value of material properties in the given paragraph:

1. PCE: This stands for "Power Conversion Efficiency", which is a measure of the efficiency of a solar cell in converting sunlight into electrical energy.
2. 1.1%: This is the value of the PCE of μmR-polymer, which is the highest value reported in the paragraph. It represents the percentage of sunlight that is converted into electrical energy by the solar cell.

So, the two entities that refer to the value of material properties in the paragraph are:

1. PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency)
2. 1.1% (the value of the PCE of μmR-polymer)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| PCE |
| 1.1% |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
